item.value: On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
Sound travels at a speed of around 767 miles per hour (1,230 kilometres per hour).
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
The earliest dated printed book is the "Diamond Sutra", printed in China almost 3,000 thousand years ago.
About two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
